parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Detection </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Count how many objects in the array are of given type. This command also works with parent classes like "Air", "Tank", and "Car". For a full class reference see [[CfgVehicles|Classes]]. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> type '''countType''' objects </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> type: [[String]] - class type </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> objects: [[Array]] - array of [[Object]]s </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_count = "Tank" [[countType]] [[list]] _triggerOne;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_count = "B_medic_F" [[countType]] [[units]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[count]], [[isKindOf]], [[typeOf]], [[countFriendly]], [[countEnemy]], [[countSide]], [[countUnknown]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on April 23, 2007 - 16:34
<dt class="note">[[User:Kronzky|Kronzky]]
<dd class="note">This command can be used on the whole [[ArmA: CfgVehicles|hierarchical class tree]] (i.e. when checking a [[ArmA:_Vehicles#Wheeled|HMMWV]], one could test for "HMMWV50", "Car", "LandVehicle", etc.)
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 4, 2016 - 13:30 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">To complement Kronzky's note, if one needs to count exact types, [[countType]] is not suitable for this, use [[count]] instead:
<code>_count = {[[typeOf]] _x == "B_medic_F"} [[count]] [[units]] [[player]];</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
